newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bus fares to rise shortly - newspapers.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bus fares to rise shortly - newspapers.

text.p: Public bus fares in Argentina will rise at least 10 percent after new taxes on diesel fuel come into effect shortly, local media said Friday.
Minimum bus fares will rise to between $0.55 and $0.60 from $0.50 in the next few days, according to different estimates by the local dailies Clarin and La Nacion.
The newspapers said the fare hikes were decided Thursday by the team of Economy Minister Roque Fernandez.
The Senate voted into law late Wednesday a package of tax reforms which is expected to be enacted October 1.
The package includes a 46 percent increase in diesel tax, a 12 percent rise in gasoline tax and higher tax on sales of natural gas and diesel vehicles.
